revised_title: The Influence of the Brain on Animal Heat Generation
tldr: Brodie conducted experiments to understand the relationship between the brain and the generation of animal heat. He found that when the functions of the brain were suspended, no heat was generated, and the animal cooled more rapidly. This led him to conclude that the temperature of warm-blooded animals is significantly influenced by the nervous system, but the exact nature of this connection remains unclear.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Animal Physiology
